D-score for measuring neurocognitive development 0-4 years Preface

D-score for measuring neurocognitive development 0-4 years Stef van Buuren 2018-04-04 Preface This is an introductory booklet on the measurement of child development by means of the D-score. The D-score is a one-number summary that quantifies generic neurocognitive development for children with ages 0-4 years. This is the first in a series of three booklets. The series consists of the following titles: D-score for measuring neurocognitive development 0-4 years (this booklet) D-score for international comparisons D-score for creating better instruments The development of this series was kindly supported by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.
